intro: Hippia absinthoides, commonly known as the common thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring spiny leaves and purple to pink flower heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides. Hippia absinthoides is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
